required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Impact of Liposomal Bupivacaine Administered Following Placement of a Transobturator Suburethral Sling
clinical_study.official_title: The Impact of Liposomal Bupivacaine Administered Following Placement of a Transobturator Suburethral Sling for Stress Urinary Incontinence: A Randomized Placebo-controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: Liposomal bupivacaine or placebo will be administered at the end of a transobturator midurethral sling to determine if there is a difference in a patient's perceived postoperative pain.

detailed_description.textblock: The investigators aim to evaluate the use of liposomal bupivacaine to reduce postoperative pain from placement of transobturator slings for the treatment of stress urinary incontinence.

clinical_study.why_stopped: Difficult to enroll; since a similar research project on a different population showed no significance the study has been closed.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.description: To determine if liposomal bupivacaine administered at the completion of a transobturator suburethral sling will result in decreased postoperative pain compared to placebo.

secondary_outcome.measure: Likert scale to rate their level of satisfaction with their postoperative pain control.
secondary_outcome.description: To assess the amount of oral narcotic required for pain control following administration of liposomal bupivacaine or placebo at the completion of a transobturator sling procedure.

other_outcome.measure: VAS to rate their level of satisfaction with their postoperative pain control.
other_outcome.description: To assess the amount of oral narcotic required for pain control following administration of liposomal bupivacaine or placebo at the completion of a transobturator sling procedure.

arm_group.description: Subjects in this arm will received the drug - liposomal bupivacaine 30 ml.
Subjects in this arm will received the placebo - normal saline 30 mL.

intervention.description: At the completion of the procedure, and at least 20 minutes after the injection of lidocaine with epinephrine (routine for the surgical procedure), those subjects in the placebo arm will have the 30ml of normal saline injected.

At the completion of the procedure, and at least 20 minutes after the injection of lidocaine with epinephrine (routine for the surgical procedure), those subjects in the placebo arm will have the 30ml of dilutional liposomal bupivacaine injected.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adults > 18 years of age
- Planning for outpatient surgical treatment of SUI with placement of a transobturator suburethral sling under general anesthesia
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant or nursing
- Allergy to bupivacaine
- History of drug/alcohol abuse
- Severe cardiovascular, hepatic, renal disease, or neurological impairmentÂ°
- Long-acting opioid within 3 days or any opioid use within 24 hours before surgery
- Contraindication to:
- acetaminophen
- oxycodone
- non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAID)
- Administration of an investigational drug within 30 days before study
- Chronic pain syndromes
- Daily NSAID/opioid use
- Patients having concomitant procedures or not undergoing general anesthesia
- Patients who require a concomitant anterior repair or urethrocele repair will not be excluded as this requires the same dissection in the anterior vaginal wall.
